Understanding the H-1B Visa Process

An expert guide to the H-1B visa process, covering the annual timeline, lottery system, petition filing, and key preparation tips for applicants and employers.

Understanding the H-1B Visa Process

A Practical Timeline..

By Capitol Law PartnersÂ 

The H-1B visa is one of the most sought-after work permits for skilled professionals aiming to build their careers in the United States. Reserved for specialty occupations in fields like technology, engineering, finance, and healthcare, it allows U.S. employers to hire foreign talent when specialized expertise is required.Â 

While the opportunities are significant, the process is competitive, with a strict annual cap and a lottery system to determine who may apply. Understanding the timeline is essential for a smooth application â€” and avoiding missed deadlines.Â 

Annual H-1B TimelineÂ 

The U.S. governmentâ€™s fiscal year runs from October 1 to September 30, with the H-1B quota opening at the start of each fiscal year. The application process begins months in advance.Â 

January â€“ February: PreparationÂ 

This is when candidates and employers set the groundwork. The employer confirms sponsorship, and the applicant gathers essential documents such as diplomas, transcripts, and â€” if necessary â€” credential evaluations to confirm U.S. degree equivalency.Â 

March: Online Lottery RegistrationÂ 

USCIS opens its online registration portal, typically in early March. Employers submit basic details about the applicant and pay a small registration fee. The registration window lasts around two weeks, followed by a lottery to determine which applicants can proceed.Â 

April â€“ June: Petition FilingÂ 

If selected, the employer files Form I-129 with USCIS, accompanied by a certified Labor Condition Application (LCA) from the Department of Labor. Premium Processing can speed up the decision to 15 days, while standard processing may take several months.Â 

July â€“ September: Approval & Visa IssuanceÂ 

Applicants outside the U.S. attend a consular interview, while those already in the country can request a change of status. This is the final stage before the visa becomes active.Â 

October 1: Employment Start DateÂ 

The new fiscal year begins, and approved H-1B workers can officially start employment under their visa status.Â

Example Timeline for FY 2026Â 

Stage â€”Â Estimated DatesÂ 

Document preparationÂ â€” Jan â€“ Feb 2025Â 

USCIS online registrationÂ â€” Early March 2025Â 

Lottery resultsÂ â€” Late March 2025Â 

Petition filingÂ â€” Apr â€“ Jun 2025Â 

Visa approval / status changeÂ â€”Jul â€“ Sep 2025Â 

Employment start dateÂ â€” Oct 1, 2025Â 

Â 

Quick H-1B Application ChecklistÂ 

  • Confirm employer sponsorshipÂ 
  • Gather academic credentials & translationsÂ 
  • Obtain credential evaluation (if needed)Â 
  • Prepare for USCIS registration in MarchÂ 
  • Complete LCA & Form I-129 if selectedÂ 
  • Attend consular interview or request status changeÂ 
  • Be ready to begin work on October 1Â 

At Capitol Law Partners, we guide clients through every step of the H-1B process â€” from employer sponsorship to visa issuance â€” ensuring deadlines are met and documentation is flawless. With the right preparation and guidance, your path to working in the United States can be a clear and confident one.
